verses.verse: Again<WH3254> the anger<WH639> of Yahweh<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against Israel,<WH3478> and he moved<WH5496> David<WH1732> against them,<WH559> saying, "Go,<WH3212> number<WH4487> Israel<WH3478> and Judah.<WH3063>"

The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Joab<WH3097> the captain<WH8269> of the army,<WH2428> who was with him,<WH7751> "Now go back and forth through all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> from Dan<WH1835> even to Beersheba,<WH884> and number<WH6485> the people,<WH5971> that I may know<WH3045> the sum<WH4557> of the people.<WH5971>"

Joab<WH3097> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "Now may Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> add<WH3254> to the people,<WH5971> however many they may be,<WH1992> one hundred<WH3967> times;<WH5869> and may the eyes of my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> see<WH7200> it.<WH113> But why does my lord the king<WH4428> delight<WH2654> in this thing?<WH1697>"

Notwithstanding,<WH4428> the king's word<WH1697> prevailed<WH2388> against Joab,<WH3097> and against the captains<WH8269> of the army.<WH2428> Joab<WH3097> and the captains<WH8269> of the army<WH2428> went out<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of the king,<WH4428> to number<WH6485> the people<WH5971> of Israel.<WH3478>

They passed over<WH5674> the Jordan,<WH3383> and encamped<WH2583> in Aroer,<WH6177> on the right side<WH3225> of the city<WH5892> that is in the middle<WH8432> of the valley<WH5158> of Gad,<WH1410> and to Jazer:<WH3270>
then they came<WH935> to Gilead,<WH1568> and to the land<WH776> of Tahtim Hodshi;<WH8483> and they came<WH935> to Dan Jaan,<WH1842> and around<WH5439> to Sidon,<WH6721>

and came<WH935> to the stronghold<WH4013> of Tyre,<WH6865> and to all the cities<WH5892> of the Hivites,<WH2340> and of the Canaanites;<WH3669> and they went out<WH3318> to the south<WH5045> of Judah,<WH3063> at Beersheba.<WH884>
So when they had gone<WH7751> back and forth through all the land,<WH776> they came<WH935> to Jerusalem<WH3389> at the end<WH7097> of nine<WH8672> months<WH2320> and twenty<WH6242> days.<WH3117>

Joab<WH3097> gave up<WH5414> the sum<WH4557> of the numbering<WH4662> of the people<WH5971> to the king:<WH4428> and there were in Israel<WH3478> eight<WH8083> hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> valiant<WH2428> men<WH376> who drew<WH8025> the sword;<WH2719> and the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> were five<WH2568> hundred<WH3967> thousand<WH505> men.<WH376>

David<WH1732>'s heart<WH3820> struck<WH5221> him after<WH310> that he had numbered<WH5608> the people.<WH5971> David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Yahweh,<WH3068> "I have sinned<WH2398> greatly<WH3966> in that which I have done.<WH6213> But now,<WH3068> Yahweh, put away,<WH5674> I beg you,<WH5771> the iniquity of your servant;<WH5650> for I have done very<WH3966> foolishly.<WH5528>"
When David<WH1732> rose up<WH6965> in the morning,<WH1242> the word<WH1697> of Yahweh<WH3068> came to the prophet<WH5030> Gad,<WH1410> David<WH1732>'s seer,<WH2374> saying,<WH559>
"Go<WH1980> and speak<WH559> to David,<WH1732> <WH559> 'Thus says Yahweh,<WH3068> "I offer<WH5190> you three<WH7969> things.<WH977> Choose one<WH259> of them,<WH6213> that I may do it to you."'"

So Gad<WH1410> came<WH935> to David,<WH1732> and told<WH5046> him,<WH559> and said to him,<WH7651> "Shall seven years<WH8141> of famine<WH7458> come<WH935> to you in your land?<WH776> Or will you flee<WH5127> three<WH7969> months<WH2320> before<WH6440> your foes<WH6862> while they pursue<WH7291> you?<WH7969> Or shall there be three days<WH3117>' pestilence<WH1698> in your land?<WH776> Now answer,<WH3045> and consider<WH7200> what answer<WH1697> I shall return<WH7725> to him who sent me.<WH7971>"

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Gad,<WH1410> "I am in<WH3966> distress.<WH6887> Let us fall<WH5307> now into the hand<WH3027> of Yahweh;<WH3068> for his mercies<WH7356> are great.<WH7227> Let me not fall<WH5307> into the hand<WH3027> of man.<WH120>"

So Yahweh<WH3068> sent<WH5414> a pestilence<WH1698> on Israel<WH3478> from the morning<WH1242> even to the appointed<WH4150> time;<WH6256> and there died<WH4191> of the people<WH5971> from Dan<WH1835> even to Beersheba<WH884> seventy<WH7657> thousand<WH505> men.<WH376>

When the angel<WH4397> stretched out<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> toward Jerusalem<WH3389> to destroy<WH7843> it,<WH3068> Yahweh relented<WH5162> of the disaster,<WH7451> and said<WH559> to the angel<WH4397> who destroyed<WH7843> the people,<WH5971> "It is enough.<WH7227> Now stay<WH7503> your hand.<WH3027>" The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> was by the threshing floor<WH1637> of Araunah<WH728> the Jebusite.<WH2983>

David<WH1732> spoke<WH559> to Yahweh<WH3068> when he saw<WH7200> the angel<WH4397> who struck<WH5221> the people,<WH5971> and said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2398> I have sinned, and I have done perversely;<WH5753> but these sheep,<WH6629> what have they done?<WH6213> Please let your hand<WH3027> be against me,<WH1> and against my father's house.<WH1004>"

Gad<WH1410> came<WH935> that day<WH3117> to David,<WH1732> and said<WH559> to him,<WH5927> "Go up, build<WH6965> an altar<WH4196> to Yahweh<WH3068> on the threshing<WH1637> floor of Araunah<WH728> the Jebusite.<WH2983>"
David<WH1732> went up<WH5927> according to the saying<WH1697> of Gad,<WH1410> as Yahweh<WH3068> commanded.<WH6680>

Araunah<WH728> looked<WH8259> out,<WH7200> and saw the king<WH4428> and his servants<WH5650> coming on<WH5674> toward him.<WH728> Then Araunah went out,<WH3318> and bowed<WH7812> himself before the king<WH4428> with his face<WH639> to the ground.<WH776>

Araunah<WH728> said,<WH559> "Why has my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> come<WH935> to his servant?<WH5650>" David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "To buy<WH7069> your threshing<WH1637> floor,<WH1129> to build an altar<WH4196> to Yahweh,<WH3068> that the plague<WH4046> may be stopped<WH6113> from afflicting the people.<WH5971>"

Araunah<WH728> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Let my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> take<WH3947> and offer up<WH5927> what seems good<WH2896> to him.<WH5869> Behold,<WH7200> the cattle<WH1241> for the burnt offering,<WH5930> and the threshing instruments<WH4173> and the yokes<WH3627> of the oxen<WH1241> for the wood:<WH6086>
all this,<WH4428> king, does Araunah<WH728> give<WH5414> to the king.<WH4428>" Araunah<WH728> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "May Yahweh<WH3068> your God<WH430> accept you.<WH7521>"

The king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Araunah,<WH728> "No;<WH7069> but I will most certainly buy<WH7069> it from you for a price.<WH4242> I will not offer<WH5927> burnt offerings<WH5930> to Yahweh<WH3068> my God<WH430> which cost me nothing.<WH2600>" So David<WH1732> bought<WH7069> the threshing<WH1637> floor and the oxen<WH1241> for fifty<WH2572> shekels<WH8255> of silver.<WH3701>

David<WH1732> built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> to Yahweh<WH3068> there,<WH5927> and offered burnt offerings<WH5930> and peace offerings.<WH5930> So Yahweh<WH3068> was entreated<WH6279> for the land,<WH776> and the plague<WH4046> was stayed<WH6113> from Israel.<WH3478>
